docs.snippet: LONDON, Jan. 27 -- Scotland Yard is mounting the largest security operation in its history to protect the government leaders, kings and other dignitaries who will attend Sir Winston Churchill's funeral Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Jan. 27 -- Scotland Yard is mounting the largest security operation in its history to protect the government leaders, kings and other dignitaries who will attend Sir Winston Churchill's funeral Saturday.
docs.abstract: Scotland Yd plans security measures for dignitaries attending funeral

headline.main: BRITISH TO GUARD VISITORS CLOSELY; Massive Security Planned for Leaders at Rites

byline.original: By JAMES FERONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEADING executives of the South American Travel Organization have embarked on a 16-city tour of the United States in order to tell more than 2,500 travel agents that recently lowered air fares, improved and new hotel facilities and a general...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEADING executives of the South American Travel Organization have embarked on a 16-city tour of the United States in order to tell more than 2,500 travel agents that recently lowered air fares, improved and new hotel facilities and a general friendliness by the natives are making South America the next "in" place to visit.

headline.main: NEWS AND NOTES FROM THE FIELD OF TRAVEL

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 30 -- Trade by Communist China and other Communist countries in Asia with 23 of the more advanced nations expanded at a faster rate in 1963 than trade by any other geographical region, the International Trade Statistics...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 30 -- Trade by Communist China and other Communist countries in Asia with 23 of the more advanced nations expanded at a faster rate in 1963 than trade by any other geographical region, the International Trade Statistics Center of the United Nations has reported.
docs.abstract: UN rept on trade of 23 industrialized countries with Communist countries in E Eur and Asia

headline.main: U.N. Survey Shows Acceleration of Trade With Communist China in 1963

docs.snippet: The Senate Small Business Committee will investigate whether ocean freight rates keep the United States in the "minor leagues" of meat exporting nations, Senator John J. Sparkman said yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate Small Business Committee will investigate whether ocean freight rates keep the United States in the "minor leagues" of meat exporting nations, Senator John J. Sparkman said yesterday.
docs.abstract: Sen Sparkman repts Sen Small Business Com will hold pub hearings, Washington, to determine if ocean freight rates bar US from becoming major exporter; cites rate differential on shipments from other nations to Eur mkt

headline.main: HEARINGS SLATED ON BEEF EXPORTS; Senators to Study Impact of Ocean Freight Charges

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 3 -- The music festival of San Carlos de Bariloche, a courageous attempt by a handful of music-lovers to create a haven for chamber music in Argentina's beautiful southern lake region at the foothills of the majestic Andes, is...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 3 -- The music festival of San Carlos de Bariloche, a courageous attempt by a handful of music-lovers to create a haven for chamber music in Argentina's beautiful southern lake region at the foothills of the majestic Andes, is about to acquire an international patron.
docs.abstract: Camping Musical of Bariloche (San Carlos de Bariloche, Argentina): Internatl Chamber Music Acad of Rome, Italy, offers to organize and manage festival; its dir, A Lysy, offered post of festival dir; comments; vain effort of past several yrs to enlist US aid revd; US Amb Martin now pledges to seek US aid

headline.main: ARGENTINE MUSIC GETS ITALIAN AID; Rome Academy Will Manage and Publicize Festivals
